get.description:
Returns the current Chaos triggers configuration.
This API route will return an error if Chaos is not enabled at runtime.

put.description:
Set the Chaos triggers configuration and return the updated values.
This API route will return an error if Chaos is not enabled at runtime.

If any triggers are omitted from the request, then those are reset to their
default values with a 0% probability (ie: disabled).
Setting a blank `{}` will reset all triggers to their default values.

get.description: Returns basic runtime information, message totals and latest release version.

Returns the summary of a message, marking the message as read.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

Returns the message headers as an array. Note that header keys are returned alphabetically.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message headers.

Returns the summary of the message HTML checker.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

Returns the summary of the message Link checker.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

This will return the attachment part using the appropriate Content-Type.

The ID can be set to `latest` to reference the latest message.

This will return a cropped 180x120 JPEG thumbnail of an image attachment.
If the image is smaller than 180x120 then the image is padded. If the attachment is not an image then a blank image is returned.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

Returns the full email source as plain text.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message source.

post.description:
Release a message via a pre-configured external SMTP server. This is only enabled if message relaying has been configured.

The ID can be set to `latest` to reference the latest message.

To.description: Array of email addresses to relay the message to

get.description:
Returns the SpamAssassin summary (if enabled) of the message.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.
Returns messages from the mailbox ordered from newest to oldest.

put.description: If no IDs are provided then all messages are updated.

delete.description: Delete individual or all messages. If no IDs are provided then all messages are deleted.

get.description: Returns messages matching [a search](https://mailpit.axllent.org/docs/usage/search-filters/), sorted by received date (descending).

post.description: Send a message via the HTTP API.

get.description: Returns a JSON array of all unique message tags.

put.description: This will overwrite any existing tags for selected message database IDs. To remove all tags from a message, pass an empty tags array.

Tags.description: Array of tag names to set

parameters.description: The url-encoded tag name to rename
parameters.name: Tag

delete.description: Deletes a tag. This will not delete any messages with the tag, but will remove the tag from any messages containing the tag.

parameters.description: The url-encoded tag name to delete
parameters.name: Tag

get.description:
Returns configuration settings for the web UI.
Intended for web UI only!

Renders just the message's HTML part which can be used for UI integration testing.
Attached inline images are modified to link to the API provided they exist.
Note that is the message does not contain a HTML part then an 404 error is returned.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

parameters.description:
If this is route is to be embedded in an iframe, set embed to `1` in the URL to add `target="_blank"` and `rel="noreferrer noopener"` to all links.

In addition, a small script will be added to the end of the document to post (postMessage()) the height of the document back to the parent window for optional iframe height resizing.

Note that this will also *transform* the message into a full HTML document (if it isn't already), so this option is useful for viewing but not programmatic testing.
parameters.name: embed

get.description:
Renders just the message's text part which can be used for UI integration testing.

The ID can be set to `latest` to return the latest message.

Address.description:
An address such as "Barry Gibbs <bg@example.com>" is represented
as Address{Name: "Barry Gibbs", Address: "bg@example.com"}.
Address.title: Address represents a single mail address.

Messages.description: Total number of messages in the database

SMTPAcceptedSize.description: Total runtime accepted messages size in bytes

Tags.description: Tags and message totals per tag

Unread.description: Total number of messages in the database

Attachment.description: Attachment struct for inline and attachments

HTMLCheckResponse.description: Response represents the HTML check response struct

Platforms.description: All platforms tested, mainly for the web UI

Name.description: Friendly name of result, combining family, platform & version

NoteNumber.description: Note number for partially supported if applicable

Found.description: Number of matches in the document

HTMLCheckTotal.description: Total weighted result for all scores

Nodes.description: Total number of HTML nodes detected in message

LinkCheckResponse.description: Response represents the Link check response

Date.description: Message date if set, else date received

Attachments.description: Whether the message has any attachments

Snippet.description: Message snippet includes up to 250 characters

MessagesSummary.description: MessagesSummary is a summary of a list of messages

messages_count.description: Total number of messages matching current query

total.description: Total number of messages in mailbox

unread.description: Total number of unread messages in mailbox

SendRequest.description: SendRequest to send a message via HTTP

Content.description: Base64-encoded string of the file content

ContentID.description:
Optional Content-ID (`cid`) for attachment.
If this field is set then the file is attached inline.

ContentType.description:
Optional Content Type for the the attachment.
If this field is not set (or empty) then the content type is automatically detected.

HTML.example: Mailpit is awesome!

Subject.example: Mailpit message via the HTTP API

Error.description: If populated will return an error string

IsSpam.description: Whether the message is spam or not

Score.description: Total spam score based on triggered rules

ErrorCode.description: SMTP error code to return. The value must range from 400 to 599.

Probability.description: Probability (chance) of triggering the error. The value must range from 0 to 100.

WebUIConfiguration.description: Response includes global web UI settings

ChaosEnabled.description: Whether Chaos support is enabled at runtime

DuplicatesIgnored.description: Whether messages with duplicate IDs are ignored

Label.description: Optional label to identify this Mailpit instance

AllowedRecipients.description: Only allow relaying to these recipients (regex)

OverrideFrom.description: Overrides the "From" address for all relayed messages

ReturnPath.description: Enforced Return-Path (if set) for relay bounces

BinaryResponse.description: Binary data response which inherits the attachment's content type.

ChaosResponse.description: Response for the Chaos triggers configuration

ErrorResponse.description:
Server error will return with a 400 status code
with the error message in the body

NotFoundResponse.description: Not found error will return a 404 status code

sendMessageResponse.description: Confirmation message for HTTP send API
